ec-7-1.text: Both verses compare the value of a good name/reputation to material wealth.

prv-22-1.text: Both verses compare the value of a good name/reputation to material wealth.

prv-3-5.text: Both passages speak about trusting in the Lord.
These verses share the theme of committing one's ways to the Lord.

prv-3-6.text: Both passages speak about trusting in the Lord and His guidance.

mt-5-44.text: Both teach about loving enemies and showing kindness to them.
Continuation of the teaching about kindness to enemies.

prv-25-21.text: Jesus's teaching on loving enemies parallels this Proverb.
Paul quotes this proverb in his letter to the Romans.

prv-25-22.text: Jesus's teaching on loving enemies parallels this Proverb.
Paul quotes this proverb in his letter to the Romans.

prv-1-7.text: Both verses state that the fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom.
Similar theme that fear of the Lord is wisdom.

prv-16-18.text: Both verses warn about the dangers of pride.
Contrasts pride with humility and their consequences.

prv-17-17.text: Both verses speak about the value of true friendship.
Discusses the benefits of companionship and friendship.

ec-12-1.text: Both emphasize the importance of early spiritual formation.

prv-31-30.text: Both emphasize the value of inner beauty over outward appearance.

prv-15-1.text: Both verses speak about the power of gentle speech.

prv-14-12.text: Identical proverb repeated, warning about trusting our own judgment.
